#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Elche
#Text=Elche is in the Valencia region , southeastern Spain .
#Text=Elche is the Spanish name of the city , and it is also known by its Valencian name Elx .
#Text=Understand
#Text=A city of 225,000 inhabitants , Elche is located just outside Alicante and is the capital of the Baix Vinalopó region .
#Text=The Vinalopó River divides the city in two .
#Text=Elche has a history as an industrial city ( especially known for its shoe industries ) .
#Text=Today the industries are still present , but the city also offers different attractions and services for visitors — among them the huge world heritage listed palm grove .
#Text=Tourist Info Elx ( Main Office ) , Plaça del Parc , 3 , ☏ +52966658196 , ✉ elx@touristinfo.net .
#Text=By plane
#Text=Aeropuerto de Alicante-Elche ( ALC L'Altet Airport ) ( from Elche ) .
#Text=This airport has flights to over 50 destinations at least weekly .
#Text=One terminal is in service , known as Terminal N or the new terminal .
#Text=Terminals T1 and T2 that were used before the construction of the new terminal are no longer in service .
#Text=By boat
#Text=The port of Alicante is 20km away , and you can get there by ferry from the Balearic Islands and Oran in Algeria .
#Text=By train
#Text=Elche is on the Alicante - Murcia line .
#Text=From either of those cities you can connect to most major cities in Spain .
#Text=The train line passes the city through an underground tunnel , and there are two railway stations in the city .
#Text=Renfe regional train ( cercanía ) line C1 can get you from Alicante to Elche in half an hour , and from Murcia in under one hour .
#Text=Estación de Tren de Elx Parc ( Elx Parc Train Station ) , Avda del Ferrocarril Este , 10 , ☏ +34902432343 .
#Text=The primary train station , conveniently located next to the bus station .
#Text=Estación de Tren de Elx-Carrús ( Elx-Carrús Train Station ) , Avda Llibertad , s/n , ☏ +34902432343 .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Estació Autobusos Elx ( Elche Bus Station ) , Avda del Alcalde Vicente Quiles , 8 ( near the rail station ) , ☏ +34966615050 , ✉ info@pimesa.es .
#Text=The modern bus station has connection both to Spanish and international destinations .
#Text=Facilities at the station include a restaurant and 24-hr convenience shop .
#Text=Bus companies
#Text=Alsa , tel +34 902 422 242 .
#Text=Autocares Melillense , tel +34 965 456 947 .
#Text=Mollá ( Grupo subús ) , tel +34 965 424 242 .
#Text=Serrano , tel +34 965 456 146 .
#Text=Autobuses Urbanos de Elche , tel +34 965 420 392 .
#Text=Vegabús , tel +34 966 613 222 .
#Text=By car
#Text=A-7 ( European route E15 ) stretches along the Mediterranean coast and connects the city to the French border in the north and Algeciras and beyond in the south .
#Text=Another main route is A-31 connecting Elche to Central Spain .
#Text=Regional roads connects
#Text=Elche to places like Alicante and Murcia .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Autobusos Urbans d'Elx ( AUESA ) operates a fairly extensive network of bus routes .
#Text=A single journey costs € 1.35 , payable to the driver on entry ; night journeys cost € 1.45 .
#Text=If you plan to use the bus frequently , it may be worth purchasing a Bus Bono card , which will give you ten journeys for € 8.40 .
#Text=A route map can be downloaded here , and detailed route maps with schedules can be downloaded here .
#Text=For travelers with smart phones , BusElche is a useful Android app with a route planner and estimated travel times .
#Text=By car
#Text=At certain times of the day it might be impossible to find a parking space downtown , therefore you 're better off going by bus or foot .
#Text=Palmeral of Elche
#Text=One of the world 's largest palm groves and the only one in Europe , this was established by the Phoenicians and expanded by the Arabs in the 8th and 9th centuries .
#Text=The palmeral consists of several parts spreading across downtown .
#Text=It was inscribed on the UNESCO World Heritage List in 2000 .
#Text=L'Hort del Cura ( Huerto del Cura ) , C/ Porta de la Morera , 49 , ☏ +34965451936 , ✉ jardin@huertodelcura.com .
#Text=Daily ; hrs vary , see details here .
#Text=In addition to well-maintained palm trees , this private botanical garden features lovely water fountains and cactus gardens .
#Text=€ 5 ( adults ) , € 3 ( concessions ) , € 2.50 ( children/residents ) .
#Text=Parc Rei Jaume I ( Parque Rey Jaime I ) .

#Text=This municipal park was created by combining two semi-abandoned palm groves , and has been transformed by the planting of new date palms as well as fruit and ornamental trees and native grasses .
#Text=Free .
#Text=Parc Municipal ( Parque Municipal ) , Paseo de la Estación , s/n .
#Text=Nov-Mar daily 07:00 - 21:00 , Apr-Oct daily 07:00 - 23:00 , Aug daily 07:00 - 23:45 .
#Text=Comprised of several individual palm groves , the largest of which was granted to the city in the 17th century by a wealthy landowner .
#Text=Free .
#Text=Molí del Real .
#Text=An 18th-century water wheel , which once was powered by a channel of the Vinalopo River .
#Text=Parc del Filet de Fora ( Parque del Filet de Fora ) .
#Text=The second largest park in the city after the Municipal Park , it was created in the 1990s by combining five individual palm groves .
#Text=Free .
#Text=Museu del Palmerar ( Museo del Palmeral ) , C/ Porta de la Morera , 12 , ☏ +34965422240 .
#Text=Housed in a 19th-century farmhouse , this museum is devoted to date palms and the fronds used for Palm Sunday rites .
#Text=Admission includes entry to the nearby palm grove and garden . € 1 ( adults ) , € .50 ( concessions ) ; free on Su .
#Text=Monuments and museums
#Text=Palau d'Altamira ( Palacio de Altamira / Alcázar de la Señoría ) , C/ Diagonal del Palau , 7 , ☏ +34966658203 .
#Text=First built by the Moors between the 11th and 13th centuries ; the large southern tower dates from this period .
#Text=The palace was expanded during the 15th and 16th centuries , and again in the 18th century .
#Text=In the 20th century the building was used as a prison , and finally restored at the end of the century .
#Text=It now houses a portion of the Archaeological Museum and is occasionally serves as a venue for cultural events .
#Text=Admission combined with Museu Arqueològic : € 3 ( adults ) , € 1 ( concessions ) ; free on Su .
#Text=Museu Arqueològic i d'Història d'Elx ( Museo Arqueológico y de Historia de Elche ( MAHE ) ) , C/ Diagonal del Palau , 7 , ☏ +34966658203 .
#Text=Housed in a refurbished former textile factory , the museum presents artifacts dating from the Neolithic period to the 15th century CE .
#Text=Part of the exhibition area incorporates a portion of the Alcazar .
#Text=Admission combined with Palau d'Altamira : € 3 ( adults ) , € 1 ( concessions ) ; free on Su .
#Text=Banys Àrabs ( Baños Árabes / Arab Baths ) , Paseo de les Eres de Santa Llúcia , 14 ( beneath the Convent de la Merced ) , ☏ +34965452887 .
#Text=Moorish baths built in the mid-12th century , restored in 1998 . An audiovisual presentation is available in English .
#Text=€ 1 ( adults ) , free ( students/seniors/disabled ) ; free on Su .
#Text=Basílica de Santa Maria ( Basílica de Santa María ) , Plaça del Eucharistic , ☏ +34615337821 , ✉ elcampanari@hotmail.com .
#Text=Tower : Oct-May daily 10:30 - 15:00 , Jun-Sep daily 11:00 - 19:00 .
#Text=The church was built in the late 17th to early 18th centuries in the Spanish Baroque style , on the site of an earlier mosque , and is the venue for the annual Misteri d'Elx .
#Text=Good views of palm groves and the city of Elche can be had from the top of the church tower , with 170 steps to the top .
#Text=Inside the tower itself are three rooms , formerly inhabited by the bell-ringer with his family , with photographic displays on the church facade and the Misteri d'Elx .
#Text=€ 2 ( adults ) , € 1 ( children under 10 ) , free ( children under 5 ) .
#Text=Yacimiento Arqueológico L'Alcúdia ( L'Alcúdia Archaeological Park ) , Carretera de Dolores , km 1.5 ( on the CV-855 motorway to Dolores ) , ☏ +34966611506 , ✉ web.alcudia@ua.es .
#Text=Archaeological site and interpretation centre : Tu - Su 10:00 - 20:00 ( ticket ofc closes at 18:00 ) ; Museum : Tu - Sa 10:00 - 18:00 .
#Text=This archaeological site extends over 10 hectares , and was inhabited from the Bronze Age to the Islamic period .
#Text=The most famous discovery made here is the Iberian sculpture Dama de Elche , now located in the National Archaeological Museum in Madrid .
#Text=Also onsite are an interpretation centre and a museum showcasing many artifacts discovered during excavations . € 5 ( adults ) , € 2 ( students/children ) , free ( children under 6 ) .
#Text=Torre de la Calaforra ( Torre de la Calahorra / Calahorra Tower ) , C/ Uberna , 14 , ☏ +34966658243 . Tu - Sa 10:00 - 14:00 15:00 - 18:00 , Su/holidays 10:00 - 14:00 .
#Text=Formerly part of the city wall ( now no longer extant ) , this tower was originally Muslim and built from the late 12th to early 13th centuries .
#Text=Originally a full ten metres higher than now , neglect and an earthquake took their toll and the upper two floors had to be dismantled .
#Text=From the 15th to 20th centuries it was used as an aristocratic residence and can now be visited .
#Text=€ 2 ( adults ) , € 1 ( concessions ) , free on Su .
#Text=Torre Vaillo de Llanos ( Vaillo de Llanos Tower ) , Hort de la Torre ( Municipal Park ) .
#Text=This watchtower was built in the late 15th and early 16th centuries as part of a defensive network .
#Text=Now owned by the city , it has been fully restored and is used for temporary exhibits .
#Text=Visitors can climb to the top for a good view of the surrounding palm groves .
#Text=Free .

#Text=Museo de Arte Contemporáneo ( Museum of Contemporary Art ) , Plaça del Raval , s/n , ☏ +34965421534 , ✉ maheadmon@ayto-elche.es . Tu - Sa 10:00 - 14:00 15:00 - 18:00 , Su and holidays 10:00 - 14:00 .
#Text=Initially established as a gallery for a local artists ' cooperative , the museum now showcases a range of modern and contemporary art from the region and from across Spain .
#Text=€ 2 ( adults ) , € 1 ( concessions ) , free on Su .
#Text=Centre d'Exposicions ( Exhibition Centre ) , Plaça de San Juan .
#Text=A venue for temporary art exhibits organised by the Museum of Contemporary Art .
